707858f-a.text:
Second Avenue, west side, from E. 32th (left) to 39th (right) Streets, as viewed northeastward from atop No. 3O1 E. 38th Street. Across the roofs of these structures are buildings in the Grand Central zone; prominent of which are the Chanin, the Commodore Hotel and the Grand Central Building (under construction). To the left of the first mentioned feature is the stack of the Hupfel Brewing Co. Note the lack of the subsequently erected Chrysler Building which if present would obscure the view of the hotel. In the lower foreground is a clearance on the east side of Second Avenue between 38th and 39th Streets and is not to be confused with a similar arrangement between 39th and 4Oth Street.
September 2, 1928.
P.L. Sperr

730133f-a.title: General view - Midtown Manhattan - East 40s.
730133f-a.text:
General View Midtown Manhattan, East 40's: View 1 shows the Chrysler Building and portions of the Chanin (left) and News Buildings, seen across tenements from 38th Street near Second Avenue.
View 2 is northeastward from the Empire State Building across the 42nd Street district and on up toward and beyond the Queensboro Bridge and Welfare Island. In the center is the Chrysler Building and proceding it, the lower Chanin Building. To the left is the Rectangular-roofed Lincoln Building. In the left background is the white group of buildings--the New York Hospital. On the right of the view is the borough of Queens. View 3 is east along 42nd Street from near Broadway. The rear of the New York Public Library is in the center. The buildings from left to right are: Lefcourt National, 500 Fifth Avenue (under construction), Chrysler, Lincoln, Lefcourt-Colonial, 10 East 40th Street.
View 1: WPA Photo.  September, 1931
View 2.3: P. L. Sperr  View 2: Sept. 1931
View 3: July, 1930

Somach Phote Service
New York City Tunnel autherity

712455f-a.text:
E. 38th Street, north side, east from (No. 307-313 garage left) a point to the east of Second Avenue,to the East River (right). To the right and on opposite sides of First Avenue are the Eleto Co. warehouse (erected Fall 1928) and the Consolidated Edison Co. power house. The latter is east of First Avenue and extends to the
river.
January 7, 1939

707864f-a.text:
Second Avenue, west side, north from E. 35th (lw er left) to 42nd (upner right) Streets, as viewed northeastward from atop NIo. 301 E. 38th Street. The tenerents shown occuny the 39th 40th and 4Oth - 41st Street blocks. The white business structure seen is a portion of the News Building of which the southerly side ( north side of 41st Streetl predorinates. Obstructing the
store fronts is the Secord Avenue "E;".
View No. 2 shows orly the 39th - 4Oth Street frontage, which No. 3, being from the street level shows the N.W. corner at N9th Street and the Avenue. Overhead in this instance are the Chanin
and Chrysler Buildings.
September 11, 1931
Views 1 and 2
View 3: April 8, 1936.
P.L. Sperr
